entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as the great wizard who would have been prepared to risk finding the boat. He is described as having set obstacles ahead that only he could penetrate.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as looking down into the boat and questioning whether it would hold both of them.

entities.name: voldemort
entities.description: Voldemort is mentioned as not caring about the weight, but rather the amount of magical power crossing his lake.

entities.name: the boat
entities.description: The boat is described as being very small and having an enchantment placed upon it so that only one wizard at a time can sail in it.

relationships.description: Dumbledore would have been prepared to risk finding the boat, indicating that he has the ability to find it.
Harry is questioning whether the boat will hold both of them, implying that he can sail in it.
Voldemort's magical power crosses his lake, indicating a relationship between him and the lake.
Dumbledore is mentioned as having set obstacles ahead that only he could penetrate, implying a relationship of opposition or rivalry with Voldemort.
